page.title: 09The vicar
page.content: Mr. Fenwick, the vicar of Seaton Sluice is responsible for 3 churches. One in New Hartley : St Micheals of all angels, one in Seaton Sluice called St Pauls and the third, in the old village of Seaton Sluice which no longer exists but the church still stands, it is called The church of our lady. The church of our lady is the parish church and the other two are daughtered. The church was built in 1102 and in 1103 it became a private chapel for the Delavals. It wasn't until 1891 that it was given to the parish for public use. Before 1891, people had to travel to Earsdon to go to church.When the Hartley Pit Disaster occured, most of the bodies were buried up at Earsdon.In 1961,the community hall in Seaton Sluice called Ochiltree hall was converted into a church building to make the present St
